se.sics.tasim.tac03.aw

Class Order

  • java.lang.Object
    • se.sics.tasim.tac03.aw.Order

  • public class Order
extends java.lang.Object
    Order is a representation of an order.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Order(java.lang.String otherAgent, int orderID, int productID, int quantity, int unitPrice, int dueDate, int penalty) 
      Order(java.lang.String otherAgent, int orderID, OfferBundle offers, int offerIndex, int productID) 
      Order(java.lang.String otherAgent, int offerID, RFQBundle rfq, int rfqIndex, int unitPrice) 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getDueDate()
      Returns the latest delivery date of this order.
      int getFlags()
      Returns the user flags in this order.
      int getOfferID()
      Returns the id of the accepted offer or -1 if the offer is not known.
      int getOrderID()
      Returns the id of this order.
      java.lang.String getOtherAgent()
      Return the address of the other part (buyer/seller) of this order.
      int getPenalty()
      Returns the penalty for late deliveries for this order.
      int getProductID()
      Returns the product in this order.
      int getQuantity()
      Returns the quantity of products in this order.
      int getRFQID()
      Returns the id of the RFQ that was ordered or -1 if the RFQ is not known.
      int getUnitPrice()
      Returns the unit price in this order.
      boolean isActive()
      Returns true if this order is active (not delivered or canceled) and false otherwise.
      boolean isCanceled()
      Returns true if this order has been canceled and false otherwise.
      boolean isDelivered()
      Returns true if this order has been delivered and false otherwise.
      void setCanceled()
      Marks this order as canceled.
      void setDelivered()
      Marks this order as delivered.
      void setFlags(int flags)
      Sets the user flags in this order.

      • getFlags

        public int getFlags()
        Returns the user flags in this order. The user flags are free to be used for any purpose by agent implementations.

      • setFlags

        public void setFlags(int flags)
        Sets the user flags in this order. The user flags are free to be used for any purpose by agent implementations.
